title: ISic020942
support: Small ceramic incense table/burner, consisting of a shallow circular cup or basin (diam. 12.7 cm) on a circular pedestal foot (diam. 7.5 cm). The basin has a relief rim. Text is incised on the flat upper surface of the table. The object is recomposed of several fragments.

layout.p: The text is incised pre-firing in a clockwise direction around the upper surface of the basin in a single line.

handNote.lettering: Letters incised with a relatively broad tool, in single strokes without serfis, but with some extensions to strokes, e.g. at top of alpha. Alpha has straight bar. Epsilon has slightly shorter mid-stroke. Nu has diagonal starting and finishing part way down the verticals. Omicron and theta are slightly smaller than other characters. mu has straight lines, with the middle strokes joining slightly above the base line.

date._: Later fourth or earlier third century BCE on the basis of the lettering (Brugnone). The type of incense burner has a long chronological span, and archaeological context is lacking.

provenanceFound._: From the necropolis in Manicalunga, Selinunte, but without more specific provenance. Identified in the museum store during restoration work..

graphics.desc: I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana

museum.name: Museo Archeologico Regionale Antonino Salinas
museum.description: Partially reopened following extensive restoration work. Comprehensive collection of archaeological material, predominantly from the West of the island, with an important Etruscan collection.

location.address: Centre of Palermo, Piazza Olivella 24, 90100 - Palermo

bibl.author: Brugnone
bibl.title: Luoghi di vendita e santuari: a proposito di un incensiere iscritto da Selinunte
bibl.citation: Antonietta Brugnone, «Luoghi di vendita e santuari: a proposito di un incensiere iscritto da Selinunte», in Munus Laetitiae. Studi miscellanei offerti a Maria Letizia Lazzarini, vol. 1, 2 voll. (Rome: Sapienza Universita Editrice, 2018), 55–75
